Introduction to hedgemanship

Hello world! Thought I’d start this new blog of with an introduction of who I am and what I will post about here.

item.title: About
item.description:
Welcome to my blog! I’m a software engineer with a keen interest in finance, trading, and personal development. I approach both my work and my growth with a mindset of continual learning, always refining and improving my skills.

One idea that really resonates with me is hedgemanship—a term I’ve shamelessly borrowed from Conrad Thomas’ lesser-known 1970s book with the iconic title, Hedgemanship: How to make money in bull markets, bear markets and chicken markets while confounding professional money managers and attracting a better class of women. For me, it’s not just about managing risk—it’s about taking a craftsman’s approach to trading, striving for precision, and continious improvement of strategies and processes over time.
